Article.ArticleTitle: Laparoscopic Heller Myotomy and Dor Fundoplication.

Abstract.AbstractText: Achalasia is an esophageal motility disorder characterized by disordered esophageal peristalsis with failed relaxation of the lower esophageal sphincter resulting in a functional obstruction.Treatment can include medical, endoscopic, or surgical interventions. Although none of these are curative, they each offer methods to create esophageal outflow.
This article discusses our preferred surgical technique used for laparoscopic Heller myotomy with Dor fundoplication. This technique has been developed over the author's career.
The technique discussed provides a safe and effective strategy to manage achalasia.
